intro: Cyrtandra producta, commonly known as the Hawaiian Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and streamside habitats. Cyrtandra producta has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment and is considered a rare and endangered species.
